Two classes <math>\mathcal{C}_1</math>and <math>\mathcal{C}_2</math> of Turing Machines are said to have the same computation power if for each <math>M_1 \in \mathcal{C}_1</math>there is an equivalent <math>M_2 \in \mathcal{C}_2</math> and vise versa.
